Package displays

Class PlayerCreateDisplay

java.lang.Object
displays.PlayerCreateDisplay
public class PlayerCreateDisplay extends Object
The display for Player Creation. Prompts the client to enter their name, pick their color, pick their opponent, and enter the optional fields of savedGame.txt and/or the time constraint they wish to place upon themselves (WARNING: time constraints only work on 'Robot' and 'Remote' opponent modes). This is accomplished using SWT widgets and Arraylists. After submitting the information, a new Player object is created and the client is given the Player object. Since every display utilizes selection listeners, a separate class with the method 'selectListenCreation()' is used to add a selection listener.
Author:
Jonathan Houge

  • Method Details

    • start

      public Player start()
      The start method creates and runs the display itself. It utilizes functions to create the different kinds of radio buttons and creates textual widgets right then and there. The display stays open until the user clicks the "Let's Play!" button. In then collects the entered information, creates the Player object, and returns it.
      Returns:
      Player: a Player object created from the user's inputed settings

    • colorButtons

      private static void colorButtons(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell, ArrayList<String> decision, org.eclipse.swt.layout.GridLayout layout, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font title, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font button, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color color)
      Radio button for picking piece color. Makes the buttons 'White' and 'Black' in their own group, using the given layout, fonts, and color. Adds a selection listener to each button.
      Parameters:
      shell - : the shell that we're adding the buttons to
      decision - : the ArrayList that'll be added to whenever the user picks a new option
      layout - : the layout that the widgets will conform to
      title - : the font for the group's label / title
      button - : the font for the button's themselves
      color - : the color that the label and buttons will be

    • typeButtons

      private static void typeButtons(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell, ArrayList<String> decision, org.eclipse.swt.layout.GridLayout layout, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font title, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font button, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color color)
      Radio button for picking the type of game. Makes the buttons 'Local', 'Remote', and 'Robot' in their own group, using the given layout, fonts, and color. Adds a selection listener to each button.
      Parameters:
      shell - : the shell that we're adding the buttons to
      decision - : the ArrayList that'll be added to whenever the user picks a new option
      layout - : the layout that the widgets will conform to
      title - : the font for the group's label / title
      button - : the font for the button's themselves
      color - : the color that the label and buttons will be
